title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A witty comedy of manners about love and marriage in Georgian England.

title: Frankenstein; Or, The Modern Prometheus
author: Mary Shelley
description: The groundbreaking tale of Victor Frankenstein and his monstrous creation.

title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
author: Arthur Conan Doyle
description: A collection of twelve short stories featuring the famous detective Sherlock Holmes.

title: Alice's Adventures in Wonderland
author: Lewis Carroll
description: A young girl's fantastical journey through a whimsical underground world.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
description: The quintessential vampire novel told through letters and diary entries.

title: The House at Pooh Corner
author: A. A. Milne
description: This entry in the Winnie-the-Pooh series continues the adventures of Pooh and his friends in the Hundred Acre Wood. This volume introduces Tigger, an unintentional troublemaker who might bounce just a little too much. The stories center on themes of friendship, bravery, all-around silliness, and even sadness as Christopher Robin grows up.

title: Driven Back to Eden
author: Edward Payson Roe
description: A heartwarming tale of a family leaving city life behind to find peace and prosperity in the countryside.

title: The Road to Oz
author: L. Frank Baum
description: Dorothy and her friends embark on another magical journey through the Land of Oz, encountering strange and wonderful characters along the way.

title: The Mystery of Cabin Island
author: Franklin W. Dixon
description: The Hardy Boys investigate mysterious happenings on a remote island cabin during their winter vacation.

title: Understood Betsy
author: Dorothy Canfield Fisher
description: A timid city girl discovers her inner strength when she moves to live with relatives on a Vermont farm.

title: The Secret of the Caves
author: Franklin W. Dixon
description: The Hardy Boys uncover a smuggling operation while exploring mysterious coastal caves.

title: Dorothy and the Wizard in Oz
author: L. Frank Baum
description: Dorothy falls through the earth with the Wizard and they journey through strange underground kingdoms to return to the Land of Oz.

title: The Little Star
author: AI
description: A charming tale about a little star who wanted to shine brighter.
